result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D Lecus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.  **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
-----------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
-----------------------------------

No contact with the victms without the victims' and Agent's consent. Defendant MAY have contact with Nicholas Zingdale.
-----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
-----------------------------------

*AMENDMENT 05/11/2017 - Pursuant to Stipulation for Restitution Filed 05/04/2017 and Order on Stipulation for Restitution Filed 05/08/2017, it is ordered that defendant is to pay restitution in the amount of $206,491.28 and restitution surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
with work release privileges to commence on or before September 30, 2016 @ 8:00 a.m.---------------
**10/11/2016 CORRECTION:  The conditional jail time was to commence on or before noon on Saturday, October 1, 2016.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas D Lecus

records.addlTxt: Probation extended one year; new discharge date 09-27-2023

Defendant Nicholas D Lecus in court. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DDA James Sempf. Court in session @ 2:16 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for probation review hearing. Court addresses the defendant who objects to extension of probation as he believes he has made a good faith effort to pay. Response by the State that he has only paid $7,000 since 2016.
2:23 p.m.- Agent Elizabeth Krajcir appears late by telephone who explains that file was just transferred to her and she was unaware of the hearing today. Agent reviews notes in the file as to payment history and responds to Court's questions.  Further discussion off the record. Defendant responds to further questions of the Court. Court orders $1,000.00 per month starting September 1st. 
2:40 p.m. - Court makes record of his decision. Agent to submit extension paperwork. If defendant makes all payments during the next year he will find a good faith effort at that time and reduce balance to civil judgment.  Agent will be submitting paperwork tomorrow morning.
Probation review hearing on August 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Affidavit in Support of 809.30 Petition

Rule 809.30 Petition for New Trial
Associated with Charge #5
Associated with Charge #4
BOND QUASHED

Defendant Nicholas D Lecus in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 8:30 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for sentencing. Parties have a joint recommendation. 
8:31 a.m. - Atty. Mastantuono makes record of agreement.
8:34 a.m. - State makes a record as to victim's rights. Court inquires whether any of the victims wish to make a statement. Victim,  J.L. reads his victim impact statement to the Court, and responds to the Court's questions.
8:41 a.m. - Attorneys respond to Court's questions regarding the agreement.
8:45 a.m. - Statement by M.S.,  grandmother speaks on behalf of her granddaughter, who was a victim.
8:49 a.m. - Statement by J.L., father to J.L. (victim)
8:53 a.m. - Statement by mother of victim 
8:55 a.m. - Court takes short recess to review victim impact statements and make decision.
9:02 a.m. - Court back in session with same appearances. Court has reviewed the victim impact statements, and makes a record. Atty. Mastantuono makes a short record as to agreement and asks the Court to accept the joint recommendation.
9:12 a.m. - Court makes a record and adopts the agreement of the parties. 

SENTENCE WITHHELD DEFENDANT PLACED ON PROBATION FOR SIX (6) YEARS WITH THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
*Six (6) months in the Walworth County Jail with work release privileges to COMMENCE ON OR BEFORE SEPTEMBER 30, 2016 @ 8:00 A.M.
*Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees
*Counseling as recommended by the Agent
*No contact with the victims without the victims' and Agent's consent. Defendant may have contact with Nicholas Zingdale.
*Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge

Court in recess @ 9:15 a.m.
Sentencing hearing on September 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas D Lecus in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in session @ 4:10 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for final pretrial, but parties have reached an agreement. Defendant to plead today and matter to be set out for sentencing. Atty. Mastantuono makes a record and states the agreement for the Court. Record by ADA Johnson as to victim notification/rights. Parties respond to Court's questions regarding restitution and agreement.
Court addresses defendant as to plea and goes over plea questionnaire, elements of the offense and maximum penalties with Mr. Lecus. Court gives deportation, voting, and firearms warnings. Atty. Mastantuono stipulates to factual basis in criminal complaint.

DEFENDANT ENTERS NO CONTEST PLEAS TO COUNTS #4 AND #5. REMAINING COUNTS ARE DISMISSED AND READ-IN. (#1, #2, #3, #6)
MATTER SET OVER FOR SENTENCING.

Court in recess @ 4:22 p.m.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on August 3, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Nicholas D Lecus in court with attorney Leah Thomas for attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Daniel A. Necci appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion deadline 05-31-16. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Transcript of preliminary hearing before the Hon. Phillip A. Koss on October 6, 2015
Court Reporter:  Janet Schulz
Motion for Substitution of Judge
Defendant Nicholas D Lecus in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered. Bond Remains. Minutes filed.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
In Court file

Defendant Nicholas D Lecus in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court in session @ 3:44 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for preliminary hearing. 
3:44 p.m. - State calls Sgt. Paul Schmidt who is duly sworn and responds to direct exam. Exhibit #1 identified. State moves Exhibit #1 into evidence. Attorney Mastantuono remains moot. Court receives exhibit.
3:46 p.m. - Cross exam by Attorney Mastantuono. State moves paragraph #18 stricken from complaint. Attorney Mastantuono does not object and cross exam continues.
3:53 p.m. - No redirect by the State. Witness is excused.
3:54 p.m. - Evidence closed. Court makes a finding that probable cause exists and binds the defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for October 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Minutes filed.

**10/29/2015 - Transcript FILED;  Court Reporter:  Janet Schulz  (df)
Signed bond filed with the court.
Preliminary hearing at 10-06-2015 03:30 pm
No contact with Nicholas Zingale is lifted.

Defendant Nicholas D Lecus in court with attorney Craig Mastantuono.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Atty Mastantuono granted. Preliminary hearing requested, time period waived. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

*AMENDMENT 9-23-15 NO CONTACT WITH NICHOLAS ZINGALE IS LIFTED*
Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH JOSEPH LARSON, NICHOLAS ZINGALE, ALEXANDER HORNACK, MACKENZIE STENSON, JACOB LARSON, JAMES STENSON.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant Nicholas D Lecus appeared, Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
